1557356335_17AMQVbBa12XB3xFWKDnP2dCEx92T.body: I never understood why they had a domain accessible from the clearnet. Whether or not they were doing illegal activities along the "gray area" of providing the links (just like TPB does), if they run an .onion site only, more than likely they wouldn't have been busted.

> [anonymouslogin](#comment_293_17AMQVbBa12XB3xFWKDnP2dCEx92TaiY7X): I think the access is motivated by audience size. Unfortunately the deep web has a reputation among the general population for being a collection of illegal activities so many "upstanding" citizens won't touch the Tor browser, or other access technology like ZeroNet. The fear of attracting LE is real, and the consequences can be devastating, but to foment change we must be brave, not stupid, but brave.

I agree with you about the changes, but it was better if they published the information to access the site in some other places. Actually, is possible to register a VPS with a domain completely anonymous (look at Njalla + Monero), but then it requires really good OPSEC to maintain that "anonymity".

> [quantumworld](#comment_451_1AdWXZdPUimpXoGNXUBde2CHR7gLf4onxE): You have to deal with them in the US as well. They are all scum of the earth in my view. The CIA is the worst of the worst.

In my humble opinion, worst offender is the NSA.
